column1: Tizi n'Tichka (Berber languages: ⵜⵉⵣⵉ ⴻⵏ ⵜⵉⵛⴾⴰ
column2: romanized: Tizi en Ticka; Arabic: تيزي ن تيشكا‎) is a mountain pass in Morocco
column3: linking the south-east of Marrakesh to the city of Ouarzazat through the High Atlas mountains. It lies above the great Marrakesh plains
column4: and is a gateway to the Sahara Desert.

column2: snow can often fall on the pass
column3: but it can be warm all year round in the strong sun. It reaches an elevation of 2
column6: and is the highest major mountain pass in North Africa. The road was constructed along the old caravan trail by the French military in 1936
column7: and is now part of National Route 9 (formerly Route P-31).

column1: The last known wild Barbary lion in Morocco was shot near Tizi-n-Tichka in 1942.
